Posts.Content: Hi   I'm new to this site.  I'm concerned about some lumps I found in my breast.  I am experienceing a lot of pain.  I don't have insurance so I'm tring to find out what I can before I start doing something serious. Someone told me if they hurt its may just be cist not cancer.  If any- one has any information about this I would like to hear it.  Thanks kd
Posts.Title: cist or cancer

Posts.Content: Thank you Juanaboo for your respond to my message.  I guess I'm just scared.  What did you do when you found out it was cancer.  I don't have a family history of cancer either, but I guess the risk is still there. I really have tried to take care of myself ever since I was young. I've never been in the hospital except to have my children.  I know I need to see a doctor.  I didn't know if a cancer center would help me since I don't have insurance.  Your information has been helpful,  thanks again.  kd
Posts.Title: cist or cancer

Posts.Content: Thank you oncrx for your information on the difference between cist and tumors.  I am 48 yrs old and I am experiencing symtoms of going thru the change of life.  The lumps seem to be hard and not soft like a balloon.  I do plan on seeing a MD.  But I have another question.  I can't afford insurance now but say in the future I can, will this possibly keep me from getting insurance coverage or make it so high that I won't be able to afford it later either.
Posts.Title: cist or cancer

Posts.Content: Thank you bunnydette for sharing your personal experience with me.  The information you gave me about Key of Life in Baltimore, MD could me a life saver, but I couldn't find them on the internet.  I call information and they said there was no listing for them.  Could you give me some more info so I could get in touch with them as soom as possible.  I had planned on starting to school this month and would like to get at least all the testing done before I start.  Thanks again kd
Posts.Title: cist or cancer

Posts.Content: tweet91 thank you for sharing your story with me. It sound like we've went through some of the same things. I guess for me the waiting is the hardest, not knowing what stage its in and what kind of treatment I will be going through. I found out Oct. 23 and am still waiting for a second opinion, but I will try to keep every one informed as to whats happening. May God keep you safe and cancer free. KD
Posts.Title: today changed my life

Posts.Content: On 10/26/2007 starshine wrote: Wow, you have certainly been through the wringer this last couple of months, and you aren't getting the support you need.  Believe me, there are many of us who have been through it and are surviving to tell about it and, hopefully, improve it. This isn't easy, but It doesn't all have to be that bad.  Sorry it's been so rough for you.  Cancer definitely changes your life-eventually, it can even make positive changes for you.  It's important to know that you are now engaged in a battle that many women have won-so make the decision to do everything possible to survive with them. A support group can really help-a cancer center or medical facility in your town shoul be able to put you in touch with one.  They aren't all the same, so if you don't care for a group after the first 2-3 times, try a different groups, until you find one where you are understood and supported.  Also, find a good counselor who's experienced with cancer issues.  When I got my diagnosis, I was in shock and denial, and for a while just drifted through treatment.  Then I read Peace, love and Healing (I think that's the title) by Bernie Siegal, and it made me do an about face.  I realized I'd been waiting around to die, instead of taking action to live.  I highly recommend the book. Finally, since I don't want to overwhelm you, be aware that there are lots of complementary treatments that help with side effects and increase positive outcomes of traditional medicine.  Reiki, herbs, meditation and visualization, and nutritional therapy have all helped me a lot.  Everyone's different, so try things out and see what helps you. You sound like a great person who's had an unusually rough time-I hope it gets better for you.  Write back and let me know how you're doing, starshine   Thank you starshine for all your information.  Its so good to hear from people who are well educated in this field.  I am at this time getting a second appenion at a cancer center.  I still waiting on them to recieve the slide from the pathologist.  I'm hoping to get to see the doctor at the cancer by next week.  I'm experiencing breast pain most of the time and I feel the cancer in my breast is growing and just want to scream "SOMEONE GET THIS CANCER OUT OF ME NOW!" but I know I have to wait on the doctors to view all reports.  So I pray for patients and hope all will turn out for the good.  Thank again KD
Posts.Title: today changed my life

Posts.Content: On 10/25/2007 Leemg wrote: Many of us have gone through a similar experience.  I personally went through this 4 years ago this month.  It was a horror story.  The waiting and questionable information was the worse.  I remember at that time I felt as if my world had stopped and I was consumed with doctors, hospitals and medical terminology.  It was like the rest of the world was moving without me.  But I'm glad to say that will pass in do time and there is life after a breast cancer diagnosis.  I had another set back this year when I was diagnosed with thyroid cancer but for now I've been able to move past that as well.  People I know shake their heads in awe as to the bad luck I've experienced over the past years but I feel that I am stronger and a better person as a result of getting through all this, and using my experiences to help someone who is just facing or about to face this.  I would agree with one of the postings to take some time and educate yourself and get a 2nd even 3rd opinion.  I have even learned that it is a good idea to have a second pathologist confirm the findings.  At first it is all over whelming but once you get over the initial shock you can take action to be an active player in your own treatment and care.  I know this empowered me.  God bless you and things will get better. Thanks Leemg for responding to my message. Wow sound like you've been through a lot, but I'm glad you've come out a stronger person.  This is so incouraging.  I'm tring to look at this in a positive way, like what doesn't kill you will make you stronger.  I am reading a lot of information from book to learn all I can and also getting a second opinion from a cancer center pathologist and doctors.  I'm still waiting on them to call me.  I have my daughter here with me who is my glue thats holding me together and God is my superglue.  Thank you again and may God bless you for tring to help others.
Posts.Title: today changed my life

Posts.Content: tweet91 thank you for sharing your story with me. It sound like we've went through some of the same things. I guess for me the waiting is the hardest, not knowing what stage its in and what kind of treatment I will be going through. I found out Oct. 23 and am still waiting for a second opinion, but I will try to keep every one informed as to whats happening. May God keep you safe and cancer free. KD
Posts.Title: today changed my life

Posts.Content: On 10/24/2007 Tweet91 wrote:   On 10/23/2007 kdmackey wrote: I have went through a long drawn out period of my life.  Two mouths to be exact.  That doesn't sound like a long time but it is when you find two lumps in your breast and you first see a doctor then you go for a Mammagram.  Then you have to wait for the results on that .  Then the doctor sends you to have a ultrasound and they do this on the wrong breast.  You go to the doctor again and he sends you back to do a ultra sound on the right breast.  Then you go back to the doctor to get the result on this breast. They tell me they found somthing that didn't look right so they need to do a biopsy.  They did this while I was awake which was very scary.  I had to wait a week, well I called the doctor to find out if the results was in and the nurse said "no one has called you to make an app. to come in, can you come in today at 3:30." I didn't have time to call my daughter, she lived 2hrs away and I couldn't get ahold of my boyfriend so I had to go by myself.  I was along when the doctor told me I had breast cancer.  I'm scared, I know theres a lot of women who have and are going through the same thing I am.  Just need to talk to someone and hear there story and experiences.  I think there should be faster ways to get things done so you don't have to wait so long to find out your results. 10-23-07 has changed my life.   kd, I had a situation like yours Sept 2005 I went for annual mamogram about 6 months late since I had never had a problem I didn't worry when I didn't hear anything assuming everything was norma as usual.  A month later they called me for a sonigram seemed they needed to verify a change from previous mamo 18 months earlier at a different lab.  I had changed doctors and it took them a month to get previous xray to compare. The day they did sonigram they made appt for biopsy the next day on what was caused possible cyst.  I did not get the results until a week later they called me on the phone at work (my oldest sons 34th birthday)advised it was cancer - who was my breast surgeon.  Needless to say I fell apart and cried for 2 days but started on anxiety meds which help tremondously and after talking to surgeon and my family knew I was going to fight and be a survivor.  The result was stage IIb, grade 3 HR/PR neg but HER2+++ with 1 positive sentinel node but clear margins. They gave me a unfavorable prognosis but I went through 6 months of Chemo, 33 days of radiation and 8 months of Herceptin completed 12/4/06. Today was my annual mamo which is clear with no sign of cancer. Although I suffer form side effects from Chemo and am no longer able to work. I am glad I did the lumpectomy plus all the other meds.  Just be strong, have a positive attitude and strong faith and you will get through this stronger than ever.  Good Luck and God Bless.     Thank you so much for sharing your experience with me.  These are the thing that will help me through this breast cancer .  I'm so glad you are free from cancer, Thand God.  I believe I will be to someday.  I've been told I will have to have my right breast removed.  I am only 48 so this was very shocking.  I always tried to take care of my body by exercising,  eating right, drinking lots of water, take vitimans so this is very hard.  I know they can do breast reconstruction but the main thing at this time is getting this cancer out of my body.  I don't know what kind of Chemo I will be getting at this time but I 'll do what ever it take to beat this cancer.  Thanks again for sharing with me what you've been though.  May God bless you for helping others.
Posts.Title: today changed my life

Posts.Content: I have went through a long drawn out period of my life.  Two mouths to be exact.  That doesn't sound like a long time but it is when you find two lumps in your breast and you first see a doctor then you go for a Mammagram.  Then you have to wait for the results on that .  Then the doctor sends you to have a ultrasound and they do this on the wrong breast.  You go to the doctor again and he sends you back to do a ultra sound on the right breast.  Then you go back to the doctor to get the result on this breast. They tell me they found somthing that didn't look right so they need to do a biopsy.  They did this while I was awake which was very scary.  I had to wait a week, well I called the doctor to find out if the results was in and the nurse said "no one has called you to make an app. to come in, can you come in today at 3:30." I didn't have time to call my daughter, she lived 2hrs away and I couldn't get ahold of my boyfriend so I had to go by myself.  I was along when the doctor told me I had breast cancer.  I'm scared, I know theres a lot of women who have and are going through the same thing I am.  Just need to talk to someone and hear there story and experiences.  I think there should be faster ways to get things done so you don't have to wait so long to find out your results. 10-23-07 has changed my life.
